item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: #TidyTuesday and I looked at video games franchises and revenue just from the actual video games: Second submission for this week's #TidyTuesday, training my circular plot muscles for another challenge :) The labels above the circles are tiny, couldn't come up with any better solution, any feedback or idea is welcome! code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week-27

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: UFO sightings for #TidyTuesday and I look at the top 10 cities in the world with the most reported encounters (all in the US). I didn't do any data cleaning at all, so the numbers shown may not correspond to reality üòÑ code

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: Christmas Bird Counts for #TidyTuesday and I looked at easily-confused birds according to Mass Audubon I don't know a thing about birds, so‚Ä¶ ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è code: github

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: Meteorites for #TidyTuesday. Abandoned a couple of too ambitious attempts and found inspiration at https://uk.rs-online.com/web/generalDisplay.html?id=earths-biggest-meteorites Update: Same plot with a slightly bigger map. Thanks @CedScherer for the suggestion, it definitely looks better! code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week-24 #rstats #ggplot2 #dataviz

item.title: #SWDchallenge
item.description: First #SWDchallenge submission ever. Went for a minimalist, monochrome plot with lots of white space and as little text as possible and an @Apple rebranding came to mind #dataviz (This is fake data for an illustrative branding exercise)

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: Instant ramen reviews by @theramenrater for #TidyTuesday. Good luck reading the text, but couldn't help it, it was too much fun making this plot! code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week-23

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: #TidyTuesday! Food pairings for the top 5 varieties, as recommended by reviewers. I don't like the lines in the plot but couldn't find anything better. The code is hacky and messy but I learned a ton with this one! code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week-22 As a bonus, here is a thing I drew many, many years ago.

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: A plot about Global Plastic Waste for this week's #TidyTuesday. I sacrificed accuracy for looks and I liked it :) code

item.title: #tidytuesday

item.description: A second submission for the #Nobelprize #TidyTuesday! The same data as the first one but this time on a world map. code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week-20

item.title: #tidytuesday
item.description: #TidyTuesday submission, a plot of #Anime age ratings by genre. Seems that there a lot of PG-13 titles and especially in the comedy genre. Also, no R titles in the kids genre ü§î code: https://github.com/gkaramanis/tidytuesday/tree/master/week%2017

item.description: – Alison Morley, Tell Me a Story, The Photographer‚Äôs Playbook, p. 232

item.title: Exercise 4
item.description: – Lorenzo De Rita, Alphabet of Assignments, The Photographer's Playbook, p. 81 The list of assignments in that page was more of an exercise in absurdity that the author made than a list of actual assignments. Examples are, “Demonstrate the validity of this emotional mathematics equation: 11+22=8”, “Do everything you can to do nothing”, etc. Anyway, I started collecting some question marks (one is greek):

item.title: Week 8
item.description: Baby stuff Running Minimal Black and white patterns Shadow on the wall Buildings

item.title: Exercise 3
item.description: Don‚Äôt look at the picture (assuming you used a digital camera). Go back home. Write a short text (half a page) about why you took that picture. Put it into envelope A. Write another short text (half a page) about what you remember the picture to look like in your viewfinder. Put it into another envelope, B. Once done, store everything and wait four weeks, not looking at either the picture or what you wrote.

item.title: Alfred
item.description: Alfred v2 workflows Delete all empty folders A simple applescript to recursively delete all empty folders and subfolders in the frontmost Finder window. Original script by twtwtw, found here. Download the workflow here. ![](Screen+Shot+2014-05-08+at+12.50.25.png) Should I watch this movie with Google suggest I combined two of the workflows that come with Alfred v2 to make this one. You still use the “movie” keyword like before but you now get a list of suggestions as you type the title.

item.title: Mailblink
item.description: Here is how to make your blink(1) blink the number of your unread mails every time you get a new one. Credit to timb for the idea in this thread. Create a new AppleScript with this code Save the script in ~/Library/ApplicationScripts/com.apple.mail/ Create a rule in Mail.app that will run the script every time you get a new mail. Let it blink!

item.title: Rainy days are over
item.description: Just a few days ago I got my new camera, a Ricoh GRD IV. Here the first “test” shots.

item.title: What's on your head
item.description: A week ago I attended a street photography workshop with Eric Kim at Fotografiska in Stockholm. Lots of inspiration and nice people. I didn't make the best images but I went way out of my comfort zone which is always good! Here are the photos of the project I had.

item.title: A rainy day in V√§xj√∂
item.description: They say bad weather is good weather in terms of photography. A month ago I was in V√§xj√∂, a beautiful city in south Sweden. The first day there was a rainy one and I definitely think that the “best” photos were taken during that day.

item.description: On the first day of the portrait workshop, we had to take to take some photos of each other. Johan, a journalist and photographer (of course!), turned out to be a great model, too!

item.description: Some photos I took with my iPhone during the second day of the portrait workshop with Knut.

item.title: Portrait workshop with Knut Koivisto, day I
item.description: Last weekend I attended a portrait workshop with Knut Koivisto at Fotografiska in Stockholm. Here are some photos from the first day (click on the image to see next) .

item.title: Hello world!
item.description: The site has moved from Wordpress to Squarespace. Go here to see the older posts.

item.title: about
item.description: Hi, I'm Georgios I was born in Thessaloniki, Greece. I've been living and working in Uppsala, Sweden since 2007. Most of the time I take photos and make visualizations. Sometimes I make sketches, music or other stuff. I like street photography, portrait and the color orange. You can read more about me in this interview. I'm also a psychiatrist. I used to wear glasses. Send me a message
